page.title: 03WESTER MANBEEN FARM
page.content: The cows are home bred.The farm owns a black Aberdeen Angus bull and the male calves are sold as yearlings. The farm's main crop is grass.This needs a lot of fertiliser and 4.5 tonnes of lime are spread on every hectare.The farmer rotates his fields with grass for 2 years and barley for 4 years. The farm uses a great amount of machinery and equipment to increase its production.The farmer has bought a combine harvester which cost Â£14,000. There are eleven cottages with excellent working conditions for the workers who appreciate these high standards. The farm is very well run and is very profitable.
